parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Sets all key-value pairs in the properties object as widget properties.

description: A pop up dialog that offers a selection. Is automatically disposed when closed.

title.description: The title of the action sheet.

message.description: A descriptive message for the available actions.

actions.description:
An array of objects describing the actions to be displayed. Each action must have a title and it can also have an image. Actions with the style `cancel` or `destructive` are displayed in a special way.

Note: On iPad, an action with style `cancel` will not be shown in the ActionSheet as per [Apple's design approach](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/windows_and_screens/getting_the_user_s_attention_with_alerts_and_action_sheets). If such button is added tapping outside of ActionSheet is equivalent to pressing the `cancel` action on iPad. In case of tapping outside an appropriate event will be sent by the native side as if such button was pressed.

jsxAttributes.type: JSXAttributes<this> & {children?: Flatten<string|{title: string, image?: ImageValue, style?: 'default'|'cancel'|'destructive'}>}

index.description: The index of the selected action. If no action was selected the value is `null`.

action.description: A copy of the selected action as an instance of ActionSheetItem. If no action was selected the value is `null`.

close.description: Fired when the action sheet was closed.

index.description: The index of the selected action.

action.description: A copy of the selected action as an instance of ActionSheetItem.

select.description: Fired when an action was selected. Note: on iOS, tapping outside of an ActionSheet will also fire a `select` event. Its parameter will be an index of a button with type `cancel`. This happens despite the fact that no button has been pressed.

open.description: Makes the given action sheet visible. Meant to be used with inline-JSX. In TypeScript it also casts the given JSX element from `any` to an actual ActionSheet.
